intro: Randia carolinensis, commonly known as Carolina rose, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces small, dark red berries that are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Randia carolinensis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and wetlands.
